entries.name: Age
entries: Astrallac keep their host alive past their normal lifespan, extending their lives an additional 50-100 years, though the body around the Astrallac will begin to decompose during this time.

entries.name: Languages
entries: By default, the Astrallac does not know any languages when it enters the host. The Astrallac knows the languages of its host.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base movement speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Age
entries: Darakei live long, still as the cosmos they hail from. Darakei reach adulthood around 50, and live up to 800-900 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Coming from a history of observation, Darakei tend to be Neutral in alignment, though, upon experiencing the world, can sway towards the extremes of the alignment spectrum.

entries.name: Size
entries: Darakei have the same range of height and weight as humans.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and you see in shades of violet. When in your Origin Form, you have blindsight with a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Alter Form
entries: As an action, you can change between your Origin Form, appearing as a Darakei, or your Hidden Form, in which your scales flip to hide your race. This form appears as a race of your choice, chosen upon character creation. When in Origin Form, gain a +1  to ability checks that use Dexterity. When in Hidden Form, gain a +1 to ability checks that use Charisma. Upon reaching 6th level, you may choose to instead mimic the race of the last humanoid you have slain, so long as you have come into contact with their corpse. Anyone familiar with the creature can see through your disguise, similar to the spell disguise self.

entries.name: Celestial Rend
entries: You have a hover speed equal to your walking speed, and are not affected by difficult terrain. You can hover up to 6 inches off the ground.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base movement speed is 35 feet, as your body was built for stronger gravity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common, Celestial, and a language of your choosing.

entries.name: Age
entries: Fauns mature at about the same rate as humans, or a little slower. They can generally expect to live up to 150-200 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Faun are kind and happy folk, choosing naturally to be good.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and you see in shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: You can choose between two subraces of Faun; Quadrupedal and Bipedal.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Faun sleep very lightly compared to other races, due to their history of being preyed upon. As such, they have advantage on Perception checks while resting.

entries.name: Age
entries: Lutrin reach adulthood around 16 and generally live until around 80.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Lutrin live in their families and their small gatherings, and aren’t opposed to outsiders. Most Lutrin tend to be Good alignments, although the Giant Lutrin shift away from that more than the others.

entries.name: Natural Swimmers
entries: All Lutrin have a swim speed of 40 feet. You can hold your breath underwater for 1 hour.

entries.name: Buoyant
entries: Due to your natural ability to float, you can take short rests on open water.

entries.name: Water Lovers
entries: You gain proficiency in water vehicles.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak Common.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: There are three kinds of Lutrin, Sea Lutrin, River Lutrin, and Giant Lutrin. Choose one of these subraces.

entries.name: Age
entries: Nocturn reach adulthood around 20 and live to be about 800.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Undercommon and Infernal.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet. Caverns do not count as difficult terrain for Nocturn.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nocturn range from under 4 to over 5 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Magical Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilight forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray. Spells that inhibit your vision do not work on you.

entries.name: Creature of the Dark
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill while in the dark, and disadvantage while looking towards bright light, whether it be natural or artificial. You can also, as a ritual, magically discern the time of day, and the current weather. You can do this 3 times a day.

entries.name: Speed
entries: All Opteran have a walking speed of 25 feet.

entries.name: Clan Crafters
entries: You have proficiency in 1 Artisan’s Tool of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: As humanoids that closely resemble insects, so does your lifespan. They reach adulthood around 3 and live up to 18 years.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: There are five kinds of Opteran; Bees, Hornets, Ants, Moths, and Spiders. The subraces are close in proximity, but could not be further in their societies. Races of Opteran are found close to each other but are very different biologically. Choose one of these subraces.

entries.name: Age
entries: Psudopen mature slightly quicker than humans reaching adulthood at age 15 and tend to die at around 70.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read, speak and write Common.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base movement speed is 25 feet while on land, and your movement speed is 40 feet in water. You can use this movement up walls and on ceilings.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe in both air and water.

entries.name: Amphibious Skin
entries: While wet, your skin is extremely slippery. You can also squeeze through gaps as small as 1 foot wide.

entries.name: Ink Sack
entries: In or out of combat, you can shoot out a jet of ink up to 20ft away in a target area of 10x10x10 feet. This area is under the same effect as the darkness spell for 1 round on land and 1 minute in water. Any creatures within the area must make a DC 10 + your Proficiency Dexterity save or be blinded for the next minute.

entries.name: Sneaky Squid
entries: While dry, your skin cracks, giving it a fissure-like texture. You gain advantage on Stealth while in rocky terrains.

entries.name: Suction Cups
entries: Your tentacles have suction cups, giving you advantage on Grapple checks. This also works on trying to take items and weapons from enemies.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ursidiens mature rather quickly by the age of 12 they are considered adults however live to an average age of 60.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak in Common.

entries.name: Speed
entries: All Ursidiens have a base movement speed of 40ft.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Ursidiens have sharp eyes due to their animalistic ancestry. You can see in dim light within 30 feet of you as if it were bright light, and darkness within 60 feet of you as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Skills of Freedom
entries: You have proficiency in Animal Handling and Survival.

entries.name: Speak
entries: You can speak with animals as if it were Common.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Ursidien subraces are determined by what kind of bear they hail from; Brown, Black, Polar, or Panda. These each have their own variations.

entries.name: Age
entries: Yextan mature at 30, and live to around 650-700.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Yextan are cunning, with most resorting to an intelligent neutrality. As such, many Yextan choose to be Neutral.

entries.name: Cold-Blooded
entries: You don’t suffer the effects of being in a hot climate, such as the heat of a desert or being near lava.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of red.

entries.name: Horned and Dangerous
entries: Yextan can choose to use their antlers as a melee weapon. On hit, the target takes 1d6 damage, and must roll against the poison. The poison has a DC of 10 + the CON modifier of the Yextan it is from.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read and write Common, Draconic and Druidic.

entries.name: Size
entries: Yextan are smaller than humans. Your size is Medium. Typically, Yextan are around 5’ tall.

entries.name: Age
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Antler Size Matters
entries: All Yextan are born different. When making a Yextan, be sure to remember to choose a colour for your antlers! If you need help or want the antlers to be random, roll a d100 using the table below. Antler size also matters, but it is more for Yextan females looking for good, strong mates.

entries.caption: Yextan Antler Calculation
rows: Red
Blue
White
Violet
Silver
Golden

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Devoured Astrallac often carry their parasitic nature in their personality. As such, they lean towards being chaotic.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your insertion into a host has increased your height by 2” of the host race’s height. Roll their height then add two inches.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Your parasitic influence has ridden the brain and body of limits. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag or lift.

entries.name: Parasitic Transference
entries: You can transfer your parasite between host bodies by spending a Long Rest with a corpse, given that it has died within the last 24 hours. Any effects that are currently on you (Spells, Curses, Attunements, etc.) also transfer to the new host body.

entries.name: Parasitic Regeneration
entries: You can devour flesh to heal yourself, if need be. You can, as an action, roll a Hit Die once per Short Rest. You may also devour the body of a humanoid you have slain, regenerating any missing limbs and regaining a Hit Die. You can only do this once per Long Rest.

entries.name: Parasitic Hunger
entries: You need to consume twice the amount of food to not suffer from exhaustion, though you only need to drink the normal amount.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your insertion into a host has increased your height by 2” of the host race’s height. Roll their height then add two inches.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You retain the Darkvision of the host race, though you gain 10 feet of Blindsight.

entries.name: Detect Life
entries: Your parasite’s connection with your brain gives you the ability to sense life. As an action, you can sense life within 30 feet of you. You can do this a number of times a day equal to your Proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Parasitic Evolution
entries: Your parasite improves as it learns and evolves during its time in your body. When you hit 5th level, you gain the ability to regenerate a limb once per month. At 11th level, you gain the ability to consume a humanoid to regenerate Hit Points equal to 10 + your level + your proficiency bonus. You can do this once per Long Rest.

entries.name: Symbiotic Mind
entries: You have advantage against the spell detect thoughts, and are resistant to psychic damage.

entries.name: Size
entries: Bipedal Faun are medium creatures, ranging between 4’ 8” and 5’ 5”.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base movement speed is 30 feet, and you are not affected by difficult terrain that is caused by rock or stone.

entries.name: Strider
entries: Your legs are naturally better at jumping, your height jump distance is doubled, and your long jump distance is tripled. You can not jump further than your movement speed, including modifiers.

entries.name: In The Headlights
entries: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target, you can make an Intimidation check with a DC of 12 + your Charisma modifier against your target's passive Insight (Wisdom). If they fail, they must use their reaction to move as far away from you as possible, and are frightened of you until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag or lift.

entries.name: Size
entries: Quadrupedal Faun are medium creatures, ranging between 5’ 8” and 6’ 5”.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base movement speed is 40 feet, and you are not affected by difficult terrain that is caused by forests or trees.

entries.name: Vertically Challenged
entries: Any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sea Lutrin are about 3 and a half feet tall. Your size is small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Hydrophobic Coat
entries: Sea Lutrin to the most extreme of seas in their life. You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Ocean Born
entries: Your Buoyant feature allows you to take long rests on water as well. You also cannot get lost in non-magical open waters.

entries.name: Knowledgeable Survivors
entries: You gain proficiency in the Nature skill.

entries.name: River's Flow
entries: You can move through creature’s spaces that are a larger size than you.

entries.name: Size
entries: River Lutrin are on average 2 and a half feet tall. Your size is small.

entries.name: Squirmy
entries: You have advantage on escaping from grapples and an easier time fitting through small spaces.

entries.name: Too Cute
entries: You gain proficiency in the Performance skill.

entries.name: Size
entries: Giant Lutrin are on average 5 and a half feet tall. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Piercing Teeth
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed attacks. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength Modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Knowing the Lands
entries: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Beehives tend to be secluded and prefer to not interfere with other affairs. Your alignment tends toward Neutral.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flight speed equal to your walking speed, however, you must land at the end of your movement. Additionally, if you are wearing medium armor or heavy armor, you can’t fly.

entries.name: Size
entries: Bees tend to only grow around 3 and a half feet. Your size is small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and speak Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Healing Honey
entries: You can produce a magical honey that can be consumed by other creatures. When stored in a vessel, this acts as a potion, healing the creature who drinks it for {@dice 1d4} + Your Constitution Modifier (Minimum of 0). The honey loses its magic after 24 hours, and you can only create 1 per day. The healing increases from a 1d4 to {@dice 1d6} at level 5, {@dice 1d8} at level 11, {@dice 1d10} at level 16 and {@dice 1d12} at level 20.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Wasp nests tend to defend themselves from all intruders, being indiscriminate with their hostility. Your alignment tends toward evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Wasps tend to grow around 5’ tall. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flight speed equal to your walking speed, however, you must land at the end of your movement. Additionally, if you are wearing medium armor, this flight speed is halved, and if you are wearing heavy armor, you can’t fly.

entries.name: Warrior's Speed
entries: You are much faster than other Opteran. Your movement speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Stung Wrists
entries: When you make an unarmed attack, you can instead attack with the stingers that cuff your hands. When you attack with these, they deal {@dice 1d4} + Your Constitution Modifier (Minimum of 0) poison damage. The damage increases from a 1d4 to {@dice 1d6} at level 5, {@dice 1d8} at level 11, {@dice 1d10} at level 16 and {@dice 1d12} at level 20.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and speak Common and Elvish.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ant colonies tend to make active trade with all sorts of races, being quite sociable. Your alignment tends toward good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ants tend to grow around 5’6” tall. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Ants have naturally evolved to be able to carry things of massive proportion. You have double your normal carrying capacity.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a burrowing speed of 10 feet. You do not need to make a check to go through dirt or sand, though you need to make a Strength check of DC 20 to burrow through each 10 feet of stone after the first 10 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and speak Undercommon, Common, and one language prevalent in your colony’s location.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Moths are solitary, tending to live alone and tend to themselves. Your alignment is neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Moths average from 5-6 feet tall. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Your fragile wings can carry you far. As long as you are unarmored, you can fly up to your movement speed as long as you land at the end of your turn. Additionally, if you are unarmored, you take no fall damage. If you are wearing light armor, you can reduce fall damage by half. If you are wearing medium or heavy armor, you take fall damage as normal.

entries.name: Naturally Nocturnal
entries: Due to your origins of the insects you came from, the sunlight still feels harsh. You have disadvantage on attack rolls that rely on sight if you are in direct bright light, and wisdom (perception) checks while trying to see something in direct bright light. However, you have a darkvision range of 120 feet, being able to see in dim light as if it were bright light, and darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and speak Common.

entries.name: Innate Magic
entries: Your heritage brings with it the ability to cast magic. You can cast the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip without any material components. At 3rd level, you can cast {@spell chaos bolt|XGE} once per long rest. At level 5, you can cast {@spell moonbeam} once per long rest. None of these spells have material components when cast in this manner. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. These spells do not consume spell slots.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Spiders mostly tend to their own webs and homes, choosing to live where they can survive. Your alignment tends towards neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Spiders tend to grow only 4 feet tall at most. Your size is small.

entries.name: Webbed Walkers
entries: You have a climb speed equal to your move speed. Additionally, at 3rd level, you can cast the spell {@spell web} without any material costs once per day. The spell web or any natural spiderwebs do not inhibit your movement.

entries.name: Venomous Bite
entries: Your fangs still hold some of the venom of your ancestors. Once per day, you can make a melee bite attack against a creature, the attack roll being 1d20 + Your Dexterity Modifier + Proficiency. When this hits, this does a number of d4 acid damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and speak Common and one language of your choice.

entries.name: Crushing Paws
entries: Your arms are as thick as logs from ancestral heritage. Your unarmed attacks deal {@dice 1d6} your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Size
entries: Like a brown bear you have a large frame and can grow up to 10ft tall. Your size is Medium (5-9ft) or Large (10ft).

entries.name: Scarce Nature
entries: Black Ursidiens are used to foraging and hunting to get by, which often involves chasing prey up trees. Gain a climb speed equal to half of your movement.

entries.name: Size
entries: The smallest of all Ursidiens, Black Ursidiens only reach in the rarest of circumstances 5ft tall. Your size is small.

entries.name: Thicker Fur
entries: Your adaptation to colder climates makes you resistant to all cold damage and gives you a +1 to AC while not wearing armour.

entries.name: Size
entries: The largest of all Ursidiens. Although smaller due to non polar climates, Polar Ursidiens can grow from 8 to 12ft tall. Your size is Medium if you are under 10 feet tall, or Large if you are 10 feet or taller.

entries.name: Crushing Paws
entries: Your gut has been changed by your bestial form. You do not take damage from ingested Poisons and have advantage on constitution saving throws against intoxication.

entries.name: Size
entries: Panda Ursidiens are the most varied in size ranging anywhere from 4 to 8ft tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Draconic Fey Ancestry
entries: You have a feywild dragon ancestor, granting you psychic magical affinity. As such, you also gain Sylvan to comprehend the spells of old.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of pink, euphoric mist in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end their turn. On a failed save, the creature is charmed and takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Fey Draconic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common, Draconic, and if your DM thinks it possible, Sylvan.

entries.name: Chimera Uniqueness
entries: As a chimera elf, you were born with two bizarre traits that differentiate you from other elves. These traits grow with you, improving at 5th level. You can choose two or roll twice from the table below.

entries.caption: Chimera Traits
rows: Darkvision. You have the eyes of an apex predator, being useful for stalking prey and defending your home. You may choose the appearance of your eyes, including but not limited to their colour, their species, and their number. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and darkness within 120 feet of you as if it were dim light. These ranges increase at level 5 to 120 feet from 60 feet, and 180 feet from 120 feet.

Snout. You have the nose of a hunter. You have advantage on perception checks that rely on smell. At 5th level, you gain an additional bonus of +5 to both survival and perception checks. You can choose the appearance of the nose, or whether it is even distinguishable from a normal elven nose.

Ears. You have the cautious ears of prey. These replace your normal, pointed elven ears, and you can choose the form they take. You have advantage on perception checks that rely on sound. At 5th level, you gain a +5 to both your performance and cannot be surprised.

Beak. You can use your bonus action to attack a creature with your beak. On a hit, they take 1d4 plus your Strength modifier. At 5th level, you can make two attacks with your beak whenever you do this as a bonus action. You can choose the appearance of the beak, though it must be a beak of some form.

Claws. Your unarmed attacks do 1d6 + your Strength modifier. At 5th level, your claws cause the target to bleed, taking your Strength modifier in damage for 1d4 turns. A target cannot have the bleeding effect on them multiple times, and can only bleed once per combat.

Webbed Arms. You gain a glide speed (not a flight speed) equal to half your base movement. When gliding, you descend 10 feet every turn. Fall damage is halved for you because of this. At 5th level, you only take ¼ of the total fall damage, and can glide up to your entire base movement speed. You cannot use this ability if you are wearing heavy armor. If you are wearing medium armor, your glide distance is halved.

Padded Feet. You have advantage on acrobatics checks, and always land upright after a fall. Once you hit 5th level, you gain a bonus of +5 to your stealth, so long as you are not encumbered in any form.

Infused Blood. You have monstrous blood in your veins. You are resistant to one type of elemental damage of your choice. (Fire, Lightning, Cold, Thunder.) At 5th level, whenever you are hit with this damage type, heal 1d6.

entries.name: Legacy of Divinus
entries: You know the {@spell guidance} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell shield of faith} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell aid} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Divine Connection
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of you takes any form of radiant damage, you can suction some of the celestial energy placed upon them, healing {@dice 1d4}. You can only suction some of the radiant damage from a single creature once per turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to Charisma modifier per long rest. (Minimum 1 use.) This healing increases to {@dice 1d8} at 11th level. When you do this, roll a {@dice d20}. If the result is 1, then you cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Forsaken Playwright
entries: Your patron is a cruel being who watches over the world in hopes of fulfilling its dreams. Changing your body and mind for various reasons, be it for fun, or as a result of a deal, it makes you into its character to achieve its goals. Your patron could be any deity or other powerful entity dedicated to games and detailed plots, however as a base is simply known as the Playwright; a secretive being who is obsessed with making their own idealistic story a reality. Alternatively, your patron might be Asmodeus or Mephistopheles. Other patrons include Lolth, the drow spider queen, great parasitic hosts like elder brain hiveminds, the queen of the Fey and master strategist Titania or even the mysterious and terrifying Yellow King.

entries.name: Traits of the Marionette
entries: Those who have become the Playwright’s playthings are given the name of Marionettes by those who know the true nature of their existence and their ill fate. They seek to carry out the story that has been ingrained in them from the beginning with no real understanding of what the story is apart from their own role in it and can often be found in strange or unique scenarios with no memory of how they got there.
When making a warlock with this patron consider adding one or more of these traits, adding another whenever you gain a subclass feature.

rows: You speak in the third person.
Your arms occasionally lift into the air at random.
Your eyes are glossy as if made of glass.
Empty books near you sometimes begin recording dialogue.
You sometimes pause mid conversation.
You see individuals as fictional characters in a play.
You struggle to understand the idea of having more than one plan.
Scars similar to shallow cuts run along your joints and neck.
When you cast a spell, ambient music can be heard.
You believe any story you hear to be about you.
Your clothes change their appearance each day.
You cannot enter through doors without being given a cue.
Your blood is black like varnish.
You eat food whole without any problem.
Your insults and compliments often become monologues.
You cannot distinguish toymakers, carpenters and doctors.
You are incapable of looking to the top left and to look in such a direction you must make a full right turn.
Strings can be seen rising from your body to seemingly nowhere.
Your skin feels wooden to the touch.
Parts of your skin feature the initials of your patron carved into them.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Forsaken Playwright lets you choose from an extended list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the Warlock list for you.

rows: 1st
{@spell ensnaring strike}, {@spell entangle}
2nd
{@spell levitate}, {@spell phantasmal force}
3rd
{@spell feign death}, {@spell lightning bolt}
4th
{@spell blight}, {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere}
5th
{@spell Bigby's hand}, {@spell dominate person}

subclassFeature.name: Stringed Fate
entries: At 1st level, strings pierce every joint and muscle in your body, binding your movements to what your master sees fit, unable to stray away from their idealistic play.

As a reaction, whenever you would be moved from your current position be it from magical or non-magical means in any direction or be knocked prone by a creature of equal or lesser size to you, you can instead choose to remain in place, this feature can be used an equal amount to your proficiency bonus and you regain all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Favoured Toy
entries: At 6th level the hold your patron has over you has led to becoming their main method of influence on the play, replacing your muscles entirely with material. If you would be knocked unconscious, your patron utilizes the strings in your body to continue moving you allowing you to continue taking actions.

While you are rolling death saving throws, you can use a bonus action to be forcibly pulled by your patron 10ft in any direction including upwards or downwards so long as there is available space in that area. Alternatively, you can choose to cast a spell at the cost of failing a death saving throw. You must still roll a death saving throw as normal. This feature can be used once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Page Turner
entries: Starting at 10th level, the playwright has made you into their main character, replacing all of your body apart from your heart and brain with marionette parts. Your classification becomes Construct, but your racial traits stay the same. You no longer need sleep, food or drink and you are immune to the effects of poison and disease. You can still benefit from the effects of healing spells.

subclassFeature.name: The Finale
entries: At 14th level, the playwright has fully replaced your body with its own casing. Whenever you deal the finishing blow on an enemy, you can proceed to open a crack in your chest to release a swarm of strings that pull in your foe’s body. You gain 2d6 temporary hit points from this and have your movement speed reduced to zero until your next turn.
During your next turn, after having consumed an enemy through this way, you are able to perform a number of actions on your next turn:

entries.name: Standstill
entries: Strings bind around up to three medium or smaller sized creatures or a singular large creature that you can see, forcing them to make a DC 16 Strength save. On a failed save, the targets take 3d6 force damage per turn and are restrained. They can use their action to try to pass the DC again. On a success the creature takes half damage and is not restrained.

entries.name: Betrayal
entries: The playwright uses the offering you provide to alter your appearance, clothing, items and mannerisms to that of who or what you had offered, actively swapping your appearances. This disguise lasts for one full day, mimicking the copied disguise’s body perfectly. This is capable of being detected with an Investigation (Intelligence) check of 20 + your Charisma modifier. The disguise’s memories are not copied over to you. If someone making an Investigation check against you is close to the person you are disguised as, they have advantage on this check.

entries.name: Victory
entries: You unleash the playwright’s finishing page of the character's victory against an opponent, releasing a horrific mass of wires, strings, and hooks to gouge into a target. Make a spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 10d10 of either piercing or slashing damage, whichever the target is not resistant to.
This feature can be used once per long rest and can store three charges.

optionalfeature.name: Fragmented Blast
entries: When you cast the Eldritch Blast Cantrip, you can roll an extra attack roll for a creature within 10 feet behind the initial target, dealing {@dice 1d6} damage on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Supporting Actor
entries: Your familiar appears as a marionette mockery of its original form and has a more doll like personality almost stalkerish in its mannerisms, whenever you cast an illusion or enchantment spell you can choose to cast it as though the familiar was the point of origin for the spell when determining the range and available targets.

optionalfeature.name: Guided Story
entries: Whenever you awaken you are able to trade one of your hit die in exchange for two free casts of {@spell clairvoyance}, this guidance takes place in the form of an illustrated story that draws itself on the pages of your tome and is capable of being seen by any individual who witnesses it. This effect lasts one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Mightier Than the Sword
entries: Your weapon from the Pact of the Blade feature is coated in a dark ink like liquid that drips from every inch onto your skin and the ground below, when this ink touches a magical item or an object that has been influenced by some way via magic it will transcribe the effect the item holds or alternatively can translate any language the ink coats.

optionalfeature.name: Storyteller of Control
entries: You can cast {@spell mass suggestion} without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Actor Recruitment
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that alters a creature's perception or understanding of reality such as {@spell friends} or {@spell minor illusion} treat the active time as a minimum of ten minutes.
